historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but C has slightly negative momentum, so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 (per best record/history) and modestly reduce k_C_decay to arrest complexity drift without perturbing the high-A regime.

A is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising at U=0.10 (near the best-record setting), but D is starting to collapse, so I’ll keep U steady and slightly reduce diversity decay/pressure to stabilize D without sacrificing the strong A dynamics seen since Gen 3067.2.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0), but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt<0), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value while reducing diversity loss terms (k_DU, k_D_decay) to stabilize D without sacrificing A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and near the best record at U=0.10, but C is slowly decaying (dC/dt=-0.0034), so I’ll keep U at the proven optimum while slightly reducing complexity decay to stabilize C and thereby sustain A without risking diversity collapse (noting past k_C_decay tweaks had mixed effects, so this is a minimal, cautious nudge).

A is already >0.75 but is slightly fading while D is starting to collapse, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and counter the D decline by reducing diversity self-decay (k_D_decay) without adding selection pressure (k_DU stays 0), avoiding the larger A drops seen when tweaking decay terms too aggressively in recent history.

Agency is already >0.75 and still rising (dA/dt=0.0012) with U matching the best record (0.10), so to take a calculated risk for richer dynamics without collapsing D (near 1.0) I’ll apply a mild challenge-phase U increase while slightly boosting agency coupling and keeping decay minimal (since past large decay tweaks sometimes reduced A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0); since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and our current U=0.14 is 0.04 away, I’ll revert U toward the best while slightly reducing k_C_decay to counter the current C decay without destabilizing D (history shows lowering k_C_decay has repeatedly improved A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0019) with U matching the best-record setting, so I’ll keep U steady and make a small stabilizing tweak to reduce decay (since a prior k_A_decay/k_U change hurt A at Gen 3105.1, we avoid big shifts).

A is already safely >0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt<0) while C also decays, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the drift by reverting decays closer to the best-record settings that previously supported peak A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0168), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing diversity decay pressure (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without hurting A (noting past k_D_decay tweaks sometimes harmed A when increased).

name: Low-U Autonomy Weaver
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by tightly coupling Agency to both Complexity and environmental difficulty (k_AC=0.5, k_AU=1) while keeping Agency erosion extremely low (k_A_decay=0.005), allowing small gains to accumulate at U=0.10. Its emergence appears to be a stabilizer’s victory: repeated tuning of complexity decay (k_C_decay) and diversity decay (k_D_decay) caused oscillations—several drops followed by recoveries—until a low-decay, low-noise regime (sigma_A=0.005, sigma_C=0.005) let Agency settle above 0.99 despite prior parameter shocks.
